greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Hybrid shift: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = n, a(2n+1) = A064989(2n+1); shift the even numbers one bit right, shift the prime factorization of odd numbers one step towards smaller primes.
comment: For any node n >= 2 in binary trees A005940 and A163511, a(n) gives the parent node of n. (Here we assume that their initial root 1 is its own parent).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: Above means: if n is odd, A001222(a(n)) = A001222(n) and if n is even, A001222(a(n)) = A001222(n) - 1.
mathematica: Table[Which[n == 1, 1, EvenQ@ n, n/2, True, Times @@ Power[
Which[# == 1, 1, # == 2, 1, True, NextPrime[#, -1]] & /@ First@ #, Last@ #] &@ Transpose@ FactorInteger@ n], {n, 81}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 16 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A252463 n) (cond ((<= n 1) n) ((even? n) (/ n 2)) (else (A064989 n))))
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i==2 else prevprime(i)**f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else n//2 if n%2==0 else a064989(n)
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Sep 15 2017
xref: A252464 gives the number of iterations needed to reach 1 from n.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 20 2014
